intro: [WRONG START] Pleurotholis geographica, commonly known as the geographical pleurothallis, is a species of orchid native to the cloud forests of Central and South America. It is a small, epiphytic plant that typically grows on tree branches or rocks in humid, shaded environments. The plant features delicate, narrow leaves and produces tiny, white or pale green flowers that bloom in clusters. Its flowers are often fragrant and attract various pollinators such as bees and moths. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is a subject of interest for botanists and orchid enthusiasts.
